text: Is there a way to tell whether the currently running julia session is a precompilation pass or a regular julia session?

elements.text: Is there a way to tell whether the currently running julia session is a precompilation pass or a regular julia session?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
For my purposes, i suppose that simply obtaining a unique session id would help. Does julia have a reliably random salt which varies from run to run?

elements.text: For my purposes, i suppose that simply obtaining a unique session id would help. Does julia have a reliably random salt which varies from run to run?

text: Best I can think of is to generate a global random number in `__init__`  This will break only when the random numbers collide, which is hopefully rare.

This will break only when the random numbers collide, which is hopefully rare.
